result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond D. Gross III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for Substance Abuse Program AFTER 1 year.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if he has not had one while confined in prison.

records.addlTxt: Record Review - original filed in 15CF310

Defendant Raymond D. Gross in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Raymond D. Gross in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
1:50 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Both files heard: 15CF310, 15CF311

Court and both counsel have received the PSI packet. 
Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions Probation Agent P. Grabow re: other revocation case. 
Atty Knaapen makes arguments re: jail credit. 

Court finds, after reviewing the statutes, the defendant is entitled to credit from February to May because he was being held for the revocation and his court of conduct for which he is convicted of today.  Once he went to prison, that time was severed.  Once he came back, then he was entitled to that credit. 
Atty Barkley makes additional statements re: credit. 

BY THE COURT: 
15CF310 Count 1 - 
6 years and 6 months prison with 1 yr 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to any other sentence. 
232 days credit on each case. 

15CF310 Count 4 - 
3 years and 6 months prison with 1 yr 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to all other sentences. 

15CF311 -
3 years and 6 months prison with 1 yr 6 months Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, concurrent to any other sentence. 
232 days credit on each case. 

Extended Supervision conditions: 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations if he has not had one while confined in prison. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming controlled substances.
Work fulltime, go to school fulltime or a combination thereof. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Court questions programs. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:  
Court finds the defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration. 
Court finds the defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse AFTER 1 year.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 01-12-2016 01:45 pm

Defendant Raymond D. Gross in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Raymond D. Gross in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Both files heard: 15CF310, 15CF311

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF310 Counts 1 & 4 - NO CONTEST
15CF311 - NO CONTEST
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CF310 Counts 1 & 4 as subsequent offender, 15CF311.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
15CF310 Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a Record Review. 
To be completed by 1/8/16 with copies forwarded to counsel. 
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued. 

Court questions Atty Barkley. 
Atty Barkley indicates the defendant's agent is A. Linger.  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Plea hearing at 12-01-2015 03:00 pm
Pre-trial conference at 11-02-2015 09:30 am

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.
